name: BKNY Thai Restaurant
address: 47-11 Francis Lewis Blvd, Auburndale, NY 11361, USA

Awesome food!
I went there with other moms after volunteering at the school. Lunch specials were $10/each menu. Great portions with lots of variety. The only sad thing was... They didn't have drunken noodles on the lunch special menu! We ordered and shared the food, and that was really great. I was able to try lots of different dishes plus Thai iced tea!

Excellent service. I believe I met the boss, we chatted a little bit. He made us comfortable and was very accommodating along with his staff. Food was great, brought home to finish. Will return next time.
Excellent meal served at BKNY.
I had BK Thai  on Saturday, the food was delicious. I love the fried ice cream
The best Thai restaurant hands down. Best food best drinks best atmosphere. Just go here.

The food was tasty. Had to have the Thai Iced Tea...so yummy.
Came for a friend's birthday and they were kind enough to let us bring a cake and hooked it up with putting our candles on it.
Love this place! Great thai food and great service!
Excellent food and experience, well spaced tables, very clean!
Awesome lunch
Friendly staff and great food in Queens

Honestly l have had the most amazing food here ever, and the service is just amazing! But some foods came be overly spicy so one point lost there, bot over all really great! I would recommend you get the Shrip Pad Thai, really flavored and savory (P.S when the server is refilling your water tap your finger on the table to ask them to stop pouring or dont pour at all, it's a old Asian technique)

I think I just tasted Gordan Ramsey's version of Pad Thai. It was very sweet and flavorless. It's very unfortunately as it has been on my bucket list to go due to the great reviews. I don't know what may have happened.

Update: after not able to finish half of my food, I went it sit in room temperature and went back for it as an afternoon snack. The food taste better. I guess the flavor needed to be marinated.
Always great service and great food. Ambiance is top tier!
Good food, excellent service and great prices.

Been going here for years.  Food quality dropped. Too salty and taste like it been cooked in a hurry.  Ordered Thai fried rice  with chicken,  pork and shrimp.  Found three shrimp in my food.  Not good.
Great place has good food clean great workers fast efficient and is a good dinner spot to anyone thinking of going!

We came here with a group of coworkers and it was my first time here. The food was delicious. I got the crab fried rice. We shared the appetizer we got the crispy calamari, steamed mussels, Thai vegetables cake, and chicken curry puff. Also for the drink I got the young coconut juice. Dessert we got mango sticky rice.

Perfect Thai meal in lovely atmosphere. The service is excellent. I love their fish cakes and their specialty dish called BKNY eggplant. Also a big fan of their shrimp pad thai. I get these dishes every time when I'm here with the family. Nice place for date night as well.
One star is for our server started with a K or G can not remember her name.
Excellent food and service, some of the best Thai food you can get in NYC. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

The food was really good the place is nice and spacious.
Thai ice coffee was really good, not too much milk.
The Tom Kha soup was perfect.
My husband really love his Pad Thai and I love my pad see ew.
Pineapple fried rice was ğŸ’¯
We will be back!!
One of my favorite Thai spots. Highly recommend their pad Thai or pad see ew

My mom and I have been to this place and ordered many foods such as tom yum soup, green papaya salad, curry puffs, and many more. The food was wonderful, and the service was wonderful. The atmosphere was that there were people eating there, and many others.
Love coming here. Friendly, good food, nicely decorated!

One of my favorite Thai places to go to. The owner is lovely and the food is excellent. I'm a huge fan of their Crispy Pork Fried Rice, Tamarind Duck and Lamp Chops. There is parking in the back which makes it very convenient.
This is my third time, I am eating at this restaurant. The food is delicious and the staffs are friendly. I absolutely love their ambiance. The restaurant is extremely clean.

The Food in this restaurant was great I love the crispy calamari with the sauce ğŸ˜‹ and also I ordered the baby back Rib ğŸ˜‹ with a pinot north white wine ğŸ· delicious,
And the service was Great they very kind â¤ï¸ the service I recommend this Restaurant ğŸ‘Œ ğŸ‘ ğŸ˜€

If you're craving authentic Thai food in a beautiful setting, look no further! Google recommendation led me here, and the experience exceeded expectations. From the appetizers to the main courses and drinks, everything was thoroughly enjoyed, complemented by excellent service. Just tell your server what you like â€“ you won't be disappointed! I highly recommend this spot.
This place never disappoints. This place stays busy, especially at holidays , for good reason.  The food is great tasting.  It's always hot, freshly made, and accurate . Totally recommend.
Great atmosphere quick service food/drinks great

This was our second time here. The food was good, but the service was poor. Our server disappeared after taking our order, our water glasses were empty, and we waited a long time before anyone came to refill them. Service like this doesnâ€™t justify an 18% tip.

This used to be my go-to Thai spot for quite some time! The prices are reasonable, and the servers are always friendly.

Be sure to start with the chicken satay and roti--deliciously grilled skewers paired with a tangy sauce. I always order the chicken Massaman curry (without peanuts), which is sweet, rich, and wonderfully creamy. It's one of my absolute favorites.

And of course, don't forget the Thai iced tea!
Love their green curry and papaya salad

This establishment offers authentic Thai cuisine in a beautiful and inviting atmosphere.  A friend recommended it, and the service was excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed the appetizers, main courses, and drinks.  Simply inform your server of your preferences and favorite dishes; you won't be disappointed. I highly recommend this restaurant and plan to return. Thank you

I honestly have nothing bad to say about this establishment. Weâ€™ve had dinner here several times and we also celebrated my birthday/surprise engagement party in their back patio. One of the happiest moments in our lives that we got to share with all our friends and family. We are so thankful for the wonderful staff that went above and beyond to make our night special. Food was amazing as always, ambiance was perfect and everyone working there was so kind and accommodating. Thank you again! Looking forward to making more memories in this place either it be big or small.

The owner/manager is super cool. Tried a bunch of different Thai dishes I havenâ€™t had before. Papaya salad had a little kick to it. These dumplings were more pork the shrimp compared to siu mai. Good spot!
We went for lunch. Our server was great. We had soup, classic Thai fried rice, red curry chicken, taro custard. Everything was delicious.  The price was reasonable and the atmosphere was peaceful.

Always have a great experience here.

Itâ€™s not just the delish food but the excellent service that we get really makes the difference. The staff hustles and they work very well as a team. No staff member stands around.  If theyâ€™re not serving theyâ€™re preparing setups or cleaning.

Started with the Dumplings. One of my favs.  Soft and silky with the best flavors.  Four never seems to be enough. Little pillows of joy in your mouth.

Next to the muscles. Chose mild as Iâ€™m a lightweight with heat.  While they werenâ€™t as good as the last time I was here the broth they are in made up for it.  I actually poured this sauce over my dumplings and it was yummy!

Stuck traditional with pad tai which never disappoints and an order of crispy duck which was tender and flavorful as always. Good was served hot with little wait time.

Thereâ€™s many Thai places in flushing but I like this place better than most because itâ€™s spacious and clean and has some ambiance.  Itâ€™s more of a dining experience compared to some of the smaller places where you are cramped and pushed in and out.

The sofa is very comfortable and kid friendly. The spring rolls are good, duck rolls are just ok, pad Thai and fry rice are very good, although I find the lobster not adding much to the dish

Poor experience. Our table was extremely dark, and the staff said they couldnâ€™t adjust the lighting. One pasta dish was extremely salty, but when we mentioned it at checkout, instead of apologizing, they blamed us for not saying something earlier. Disappointing food and service â€” we wonâ€™t be returning.
Very kind staff and delicious food! They were very accommodating when it came to tweaking some dishes and super friendly to our son! Canâ€™t wait to return again.

Their soups are really good! Service and ambience is nice, visited on a Sunday late noon wasnâ€™t that full. Calamari and spring rolls were just right. Their pad kee moo was ok felt lack of flavours compared to other places. Dessert selection is small. Worth a visit just for their warm delicious soups!

Christmas Eve '24 dinner.
Everything was delicious.
Great service. Festive holiday decorations.
Highly recommend the grilled pork chop, and cocunut thai icre cream.

A unique venue offering Thai cuisine ğŸ‘

My buddy chose this shop for its fried fish with spicy sauce. The food is decent & filling.

The venue really stood out with a bar in the middle of the floor surrounded by dining tables. Possibly incorporating Feng Shui aesthetics.

Service was polite & efficient. ğŸ™ğŸ»

They greet you with  a warm smile , and fill your stomach with some good hot food .
We went for the lunch special ,
Dinner time , it's the place to be .
I had Pad Pack  ( mixed vegetables ) and I added some Tofu , and they give you tea and an Egg roll ...
Everything was really good

Four stars for the quality of the food and drinks, not necessarily the experience.
Food & cocktails were great, absolutely delicious.
The downside was how hot it was inside the restaurant (almost 80 degrees inside). If it had been a little cooler it would have been more enjoyable.
It wasn't crowded, so I would recommend the waiters check with the tables every so often...I never saw the waiters go to the tables around us (ours included) to ask if anything was needed. If he had, we would've ordered additional drinks / spent more money but we couldn't even get his attention to order anything else.

Visiting this restaurant almost after 2 years and the food is still as delicious as before.  They have quite few vegetarian options available and amazing drinks.   The parking is a little hassle but after coupon rounds got a spot.  We wereâ€¦

Very good food overall. The pork on the fried rice has the nice smokey flavor. The pad see ew has a nice sweetness to it. The green curry was delicious but I recommend getting an extra bowl of rice if sharing because the rice given wasn't enough. The curry puffs were also a nice start!

The service I wish I can give an extra star above the 5 stars! Very friendly service with a nice attentive balance.

We were in the area & googled for restaurants and found this place. As we entered we were impressed by the ambience of the place. Food was good but the service was â€œtoo goodâ€. Itâ€™s highly recommended. âœ…âœ…âœ…âœ…âœ…

Small parking in the back, all full on a weekday lunch hour. Ordered regular menu instead of lunch special thinking I will get a dinner size portion. However if this is dinner portion it way less than what I expected.  Ask for spicy but itâ€¦
